question: It is true that a Python package is a collection of related modules bundled together.
It is true that a Python package is not a collection of related modules.
It is true that packages in Python help organize code into a structured format.
It is true that packages in Python do not help organize code.
It is true that Python packages promote code reusability across multiple projects.
It is true that Python packages do not promote code reusability.
It is true that Python provides many standard packages like math and numpy.
It is true that Python does not provide standard packages like math and numpy.
It is true that you can create your own custom packages in Python.
It is true that you cannot create your own custom packages in Python.
It is true that a Python package is represented as a directory containing modules.
It is true that a Python package is not represented as a directory containing modules.
It is true that every Python package must contain an __init__.py file.
It is true that every Python package does not need an __init__.py file.
It is true that packages can contain sub-packages for further organization.
It is true that packages cannot contain sub-packages.
It is true that the __init__.py file can be empty or contain initialization code.
It is true that the __init__.py file must always contain initialization code.
It is true that Python packages can be imported and used in other scripts.
It is true that Python packages cannot be imported and used in other scripts.
It is true that the math package provides mathematical functions like sqrt() and factorial().
It is true that the math package does not provide mathematical functions like sqrt() and factorial().
It is true that numpy is used for efficient numerical computations.
It is true that numpy is not used for numerical computations.
It is true that matplotlib is used for creating visualizations like graphs and charts.
It is true that matplotlib is not used for creating visualizations like graphs and charts.
It is true that pandas is used for handling large datasets in table format.
It is true that pandas is not used for handling large datasets in table format.
It is true that creating a package involves creating a directory with an __init__.py file.
It is true that creating a package does not involve creating a directory with an __init__.py file.
It is true that user-defined packages can be imported and used like standard packages.
It is true that user-defined packages cannot be imported and used like standard packages.
It is true that packages in Python can contain non-code files like documentation and tests.
It is true that packages in Python cannot contain non-code files like documentation and tests.
It is true that the src layout is a common structure for organizing package code.
It is true that the src layout is not used for organizing package code.
It is true that Python packages can be distributed and installed using tools like pip.
It is true that Python packages cannot be distributed and installed using tools like pip.
It is true that packages in Python help in managing large projects by structuring code.
It is true that packages in Python do not help in managing large projects.
It is true that Python packages can be used to encapsulate related functionality.
It is true that Python packages cannot be used to encapsulate related functionality.

It is true that Python packages are not useful for collaborative development.
It is true that Python packages can include metadata files like README.md and LICENSE.
It is true that Python packages cannot include metadata files like README.md and LICENSE.
It is true that Python packages can be structured using either the src or flat layout.
It is true that Python packages can only be structured using the src layout.
It is true that Python packages simplify the process of maintaining and updating code.
It is true that Python packages do not simplify the process of maintaining and updating code.
